concept.title: Serialize Using GemFire Pdx Serialization
concept.shortdesc: GemFire's Portable Data eXchange (PDX) is a cross-language data format that can help reduce the cost of distributing and serializing your objects. PDX stores data in named fields that you can access individually, to avoid the cost of deserializing the entire data object. PDX also allows you to mix versions of objects where you have added or removed fields.

conbody.note: PDX does not work with C++ clients. If you have C++ clients that may receive events for a region, you cannot use PDX serialization on the region's entries.
conbody.p: You have two options for GemFire PDX serialization. You can program your domain objects using the IPdxSerializable interface or you can use GemFireâ€™s reflection-based autoserializer.
